content: That isn't possible. You may want to install the importexporttools-ng add-on (https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng). With that, you can select any number of messages and export them to PDF.
creator: siffemoz

content: Domanda duplicata-> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1518891
creator: @next

content:
Hi Grzegorz,

This usually happens because Thunderbird (and Firefox for that matter) does not use the system trust store, and Kaspersky is resigning every request with its own certificate while putting its root certificate into the system trust store. You can either disable the email protection component of Kaspersky, or import its root certificate into Thunderbird. They have a support article for this: https://support.kaspersky.com/common/compatibility/14620#block2

Regards, Balázs
creator: meskobalazs

creator: Dmitriy_S

content:
Dmitriy said
I understand this, but here the question is rather not in a specific extension, but in the WebExtension API that the extensions use. And is there a way to grant these permissions to the extension in advance without asking the user for them?

I believe you can use group policies on Windows. But it is not something I am really au fait with. I would suggest your query might get more useful responses in the enterprise mailing list. in particular you might want to look to this thread. https://thunderbird.topicbox.com/groups/enterprise/Tca612a40e26047fa/give-permissions-to-extensions-installed-using-policies-json-enterprise-policy
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Se non spieghi esattamente quali problemi incontri, non saprei che dirti... Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Hello there


Thunderbird is freezing in this case hanging. You can try to start up in safe modus if the program is working then there might be a theme or add on that is not working. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/troubleshoot-mode-thunderbird

If problems are more likely that other steps are needed try to use this subject : Rebuild the global database , go to the profile folder and delete the global~messages~db.sqlite.file and restart Thunderbird. That rebuilds that database.

Reinstalling Thunderbird can work there too. Backup Thunderbird s profile folder reinstall the program. Download that latest version of Thunderbird. Restore that profile and or setup that recent account at Thunderbird again.

Use the latest version of Thunderbird and try to download from trusted download points. https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/desktop/



Questions are open.

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.
